page.title: 10LIFE AT WHITTINGTON BARRACKS
page.content: My Dad has been in the army for 17 years. He is a Corporal and he gives the guns out and works in the armoury. We live at Chester Road. The ames of the other roads are Nottingham Road, Stafford Crescent, Derby Road and Heath Avenue. The children who live on Heath Avenue are those whose Dads are either Sergeant-Majors or higher ranks. In the Barracks itself there is a NAAFI (this stands for Navy,Army and Airforce Institute), a Church and a number of blocks set aside for young trainees. Outside the barracks there is a Regimental Museum that is open to the public, and also the Pavillion where they play cricket and where there is also a public playing field.
